stories.text:
Hi everyone, all of my lifetime I have been a Windows and android user, tried Linux and didn't like.

A few months back I tried a Macbook of a friend and got hooked on it so I am thinking on switching to an all Apple ecosystem mainly because of the Macbooks batery, I work remote and would like to work wherever I am.

I work as a front-end dev mainly with sometimes full-stack and buying a fully speced MacBook would be an overkill.

What would you suggest me to switch to if my main concern is the battery life, lightweight and smoothnes of work?
stories.title: Ask HN: Apple or other longer battery life laptop

US prepares to release US$45B for nationwide high-speed internet

stories.text:
It's commonplace to mock Big Tech for being slow-moving and lacking an innovation ability with several examples of new companies that competed with, and defeated products from Big Tech. There are tons of examples of this (YouTube Vs Google Video as one). What are examples of the reverse? Like Pebble (smartwatches) losing to Apple Watch, Clubhouse (Kindda pending) losing to Twitter Spaces, Slack (??? had to sell to Big Tech) losing to Big Tech 'Work'.

Sure, there are also examples where the indie coys did not exactly die Dropbox/Box Vs Big Tech storage.
stories.title: Ask HN: What are examples of companies that died by the hands of Big Tech?
The strange detention of EU diplomats returning from Tehran
